title: How to Select and Store Limes

steps.headline: Look for a lime by type.
steps.description: There are several varieties of limes and their colour and size is affected by their variety. Tahitian limes: These are large in size and have an acidic, sour flavour. Mexican limes: These are smaller in size than the Tahitian. It has bright green skin and smells aromatic. Key limes: These limes have a pale-yellowish green colour. They taste strong and sharp and have a lot of juice.

steps.headline: Look for limes that have unbroken skin and no blemishes.
steps.description: The skin should be glossy to look at. If the skin has yellowed, this can mean that the flavour has diminished.

steps.headline: Feel the lime.
steps.description: It should be firm and heavy for its size.

steps.headline: Store limes in the refrigerator.
steps.description: They will keep fresh in here for up to a week or two, especially if kept loosely in a plastic bag. While they can be kept longer, they won't taste as fresh after this time. Lime wedges or slices can be kept in a plastic bag in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Lime juice can be frozen for up to 4 months.
